item.title: Borderlands 4 Patch Notes Reveal Big Buffs For Several Legendary-Class Guns
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The new patch notes are in for Borderlands 4, and like several other updates, this new round of tweaks to the game is focused on empowering players--specifically, their arsenal of weapons. Gearbox says that it's focusing on smaller gear adjustments, starting with several Legendary-class weapons. These hard-to-find weapons haven't felt as good to use in combat despite having unique perks, so their overall power is getting dialed up substantially.

One prime example here is the Hellwalker, a Jacobs fire-and-forget shotgun that was introduced in Borderlands 3 and is almost a carbon copy of the Super-Shotgun used by the Doom Slayer in Id's Doom games. This will now do 30% extra base damage, so if you have a Jakobs mod equipped and the right skills activated, it should shred through rank-and-file enemies with ease. Queen's Rest, a pistol manufactured by Torgue, will also start firing rounds faster, as this has been increased by 50%, while the chance for its unique perk to spawn a homing sticky projectile has been increased from 30% to 50%.

Other notable changes include damage and fire-rate increases to Ruby's Grasp, the drone deployed from Bully will do 50% more damage, and Convergence base damage has been increased by 25%. If you don't have one of these Legendary-class weapons yet, they can be farmed from bosses found throughout Kairos, or you might want to check Mauricie's Black Market vending machine to see if he has it in stock.

Maurice offers unique Legendary gear for any player who accesses his machine, so if RNG is on your side, you might be able to purchase one of these upgraded guns with a very desirable roll of stats. You can also take a chance with the Golden Treasure Chests, as these often hand out Legendaries when you open them. To stock up on Golden Keys, check our Borderlands 4 Shift Code guide for updates.

Gearbox has also made a few other changes, like ensuring that the legendary Tediore shotgun Anarchy properly rewards stacks of Mutualism after auto-reloading or killing enemies, and Vex's Bleed skill will now count as status effect damage. You can see the full patch notes below, and next week, Gearbox will upload a patch that focuses on fine-tuning Class Mods, Repkits, Shields, and Firmware. Borderlands 4 has also struggled with performance issues since launch, but Gearbox says next week's update will address these issues and add some highly requested quality-of-life changes.

Borderlands 4 Update Notes

Weekly Activities

  • Weekly Big Encore Boss switched to a tougher variant of a different existing boss with an even more rewarding loot pool for those who take it on.
  • The Weekly Wildcard Mission changed. These missions feature a guaranteed Legendary drop you can earn repeatedly to get your ideal roll.
  • Maurice’s Black Market Vending Machine moved to another location and changed its offerings.

Gear Balance Adjustments

  • Ruby's Grasp damage increased by 50%
  • Ruby's Grasp fire rate increased by 25%
  • Bully drone damage increased by 50%
  • Bully base damage increased by 50%
  • Rangefinder base damage increased by 30%
  • Queen's Rest spawn chance increased from 30% to 50%
  • Queen's Rest fire rate increased by 50%
  • Seventh Sense orb damage increased by 250%
  • Hellwalker base damage increased 30%
  • Convergence base damage increased by 25%

Additional Changes

  • Legendary Tediore Shotgun Anarchy was adjusted to properly award Stacks of Mutualism when auto-reloading or killing enemies
  • All Pets from all classes (such as Trouble, Specters, Reapers, and Forgeweapons) now properly gain Critical Hit Chance from Passives and Gear
  • Adjustment made to Vex the Siren’s Bleed to count as Status Effect Damage

item.title: You Can Level Up Faster In Battlefield 6 On PS5
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

If fast progression is what you're looking for in Battlefield 6, then the PlayStation 5 version might be the one to get when the shooter launches tomorrow.

As spotted by CharlieIntel, the PS5 version of Battlefield 6 has an XP Modifier that will add 5% of XP in every match in which you're partied up with at least two PlayStation Plus subscribers. A PlayStation Plus membership is required to play online multiplayer in Battlefield 6 (and any paid game).

A screenshot shared by CharlieIntel on X shows other XP Modifiers, including a 5% boost for simply owning the game and another for just being in a party with other players.

It appears that these modifiers can stack, meaning that PS5 players who party up with at least two other people playing on PS5 would net a significant 15% XP bonus. That's a hefty advantage over anyone playing on PC or Xbox Series X|S.

The widely played open beta for Battlefield 6 in August included a PS5-exclusive reward: The Advance Party skin, which was a generic dark-colored solider outfit with some blue accents. It wasn't the most exciting bonus, but it was an exclusive nonetheless.

A console manufacturer striking exclusivity deals for multiplatform games isn't unusual--Sony did it all the time for Call of Duty, giving PlayStation owners bonus XP modifiers and free content packs.

With Battlefield 6 launching soon, be sure to check what time the game will launch in your region and check out GameSpot's guides for the game. You can also read GameSpot's 8/10 review of Battlefield 6 right now, which calls the shooter a "return to form for a multiplayer shooter that thrives on emergent chaos."

item.title: Indiana Jones And The Great Circle Getting Free Update With New Game Plus
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

To celebrate 15 years as a studio, MachineGames has announced an anniversary update for Indiana Jones and The Great Circle that will add New Game Plus to the adventure game tomorrow, October 10. In addition, the free patch will feature an outfit from Raiders of the Lost Ark, voice language select, and other general fixes.

On the game's website, MachineGames notes that New Game Plus and the Cairo outfit were highly requested from the community. New Game Plus unlocks after completing the main story and will let players keep their unlocked Adventure Books. Since Indy should be stronger, MachineGames recommends pushing the difficulty up a notch. Last but not least, there's a new after-credits scene for players who finish Indiana Jones and the Great Circle on New Game Plus.

Meanwhile, the Cairo outfit sees Indy jacketless, and MachineGames is teasing more looks for the archaeologist over the coming months. As for the voice language select, the developer states: "You can mix and match any of the nine available voice languages with any of the 14 text languages."

Last month, Indiana Jones and the Great Circle got The Order of Giants DLC, which sees the protagonist pair up with a young priest named Father Ricci in Rome. Next year, Indiana Jones and the Great Circle will come to Switch 2, after hitting PS5 earlier this year. The game was originally released in late 2024 for PC and Xbox Series X|S. For more, check out GameSpot's Indiana Jones and the Great Circle review.

Below are the full anniversary update notes:

Indiana Jones and The Great Circle Anniversary update patch notes

OTHER FEATURES

The Xbox Series X and S release now features a Power Saving mode. By default, the GPU will spin down with it is not being fully tasked. In addition, there is a Power Saving option in the Video section of the Options menu. When you activate this, the game will enter a power saving mode if you leave your controller idle for some time; resolution will lower and frame rate will be limited. As soon as you move the controller again the game will exit the power saving state.

We’re looking to add this future to other platforms in the future.

In anticipation of the upcoming release of the ROG Xbox Ally and ROG Xbox Ally X, we’ve added detection of those handhelds, and the game will automatically set suitable video quality settings for better performance.

GENERAL FIXES

  • Fixed an issue where enemies might linger in their “stumble” animation if you punched them while they’re breaking out of your grab.
  • Fixed an issue where pushing a grabbed enemy into a tight space could leave the enemy detached from Indy but still in the “grabbed” animation state.
  • Fixed an issue with a specific “finisher” animation where the camera would clip through Indy’s arms.
  • Fixed an issue where you could enter wall squeezes while downed and using the “Lucky Hat” ability that resulted in you standing up and unable to progress properly.
  • Fixed an issue that could cause a control-lock if restarting a checkpoint during the middle of a save.
  • Fixed an issue where using the “push” button to open “disguise doors” could prevent you from being able to walk through the door.
  • Fixed an issue where, if you left a level while holding an inventory item, it would be stuck to your hands when revisiting the level

MISSIONS & QUESTS DLC

  • Fixed another issue that might cause pipes to be placed incorrectly during the Gladiator puzzle.
  • Fixed the animation of the blackshirt being dropped from the bridge near the entrance to the Gladiator puzzle.
  • Fixed many minor graphical glitches through the whole story.

Peru

  • Fixed an issue where audio was missing in the Main Menu if you quit the game during the opening cutscene.

Gizeh

  • Fixed an issue where the clothes of certain villager NPCs would not animate when the character moved.

Sukhothai

  • Fixed an issue that might cause the boat engine sounds to never stop when you arrive at the rebel village at night.

Iraq

  • Fixed an issue where skipping the cinematic where Indy frees Gina might result in the Siren sounds to never stop.

UI

  • The price of guides and books now show correctly when inspecting them from one of the vendors.

PC SPECIFIC FIXES

  • Fixed an issue where binding the interact/use key to be the same as the “buy” button from vendors, it could prevent you from buying items.
  • Fixed an issue where setting Reflections to the lowest quality made certain objects look completely black.

LOCALIZATION

  • In Arabic, fixed the alignment of the quick-inventory warning text about restricted zones.

item.title: Xbox Co-Founder Calls Game Pass Price Hike A "Betrayal'
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Longtime Xbox devotees have recently seen several former exclusive games go to PlayStation 5, while Microsoft has raised prices on Game Pass and Xbox consoles in the US. Now, one of Xbox's original team members, Laura Fryer, is calling out her former employer and describing the price increases as a "betrayal" of the trust that gamers placed in them.

"With this latest increase to Game Pass, Xbox threw away one of their last advantages," said Fryer in her latest YouTube video. "They were the best deal in gaming... With these price hikes, it feels like a betrayal, like greed over gaming... I recognize that this Xbox console generation isn't over yet, it's almost certainly going to be remembered first and foremost for Microsoft's greed."

Fryer went on to recap the two hardware price increases this generation, three separate Game Pass price increases, more expensive games, massive layoffs, and multiple studio layoffs.

"I believe all of these changes and drama will harm Microsoft's brand," said Fryer. "It appears that Xbox is moving towards cloud gaming and away from hardware, but it also could be that they're just incompetent, that they just don't understand what they're doing... They need to rebuild trust with gamers and fans. I know people on the Xbox team that are still there that were there in the early days... They can fix this and I'm rooting for them and wishing them the best."

Fryer previously shared her belief that Xbox is abandoning hardware by outsourcing the ROG Xbox Ally handheld devices to Asus. Xbox VP Jason Ronald reiterated the company's commitment to its next generation hardware earlier this year.

Following the recent Game Pass announcement, Microsoft revealed that the price hikes won't immediately go into effect for all players. But the more expensive version of Game Pass is losing a fan-favorite Call of Duty perk. Some analysts believe that an ad-supported Game Pass service will be added in the future.
